etymology.description: 日(日) (rì, "sun") + 月(月) (yuè, "moon") = sun is rising and moon not yet set -> dawn -> bright; other forms: 朙囧 + 月 = moonlight, 眀目 + 月 = bright eyes, 𤰾田 + 月 = probable corruption
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the sun and moon, which both emit light, symbolizing brightness and clarity. Alternative forms reflect similar ideas related to light.

examples.chinese: 他的意图明(他的意圖明)，所有人都能看出(所有人都能看出)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yìtú míng, suǒyǒu rén dōu néng kàn chū.
examples.english: His intention is clear; everyone can tell.

examples.chinese: 答案很明(答案很明)，无需解释(無需解釋)。
examples.english: The answer is obvious; no explanation is needed.

examples.chinese: 会议内容明(會議內容明)，大家积极讨论(大家積極討論)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì nèiróng míng, dàjiā jījí tǎolùn.
examples.english: The content of the meeting is clear, and everyone engaged in active discussion.
